thread.title: Six Flags parks place bets on Mets vs. Cubs in NLCS
thread.title_full: Six Flags parks place bets on Mets vs. Cubs in NLCS

author: app.com
title: Six Flags parks place bets on Mets vs. Cubs in NLCS
text:
MORE JACKSON - With the National League Championship Series underway, Six Flags theme parks in New Jersey and Illinois are doubling down on the New York Mets and Chicago Cubs.
Depending on who wins the series, either Six Flags Great America in Gurnee, Ill., or Six Flags Great Adventure in Jackson, will rename aspects of the park after their opponent.
If the Mets win the series, the Illinois park will be renamed "Six Flags Great Mets" and its "Goliath" roller coaster will be rebranded "GoMets."
If the Cubs win, the New Jersey park will be renamed "Six Flags Great Cubs," with its 456-foot-tall roller coaster "Kingda Ka" renamed "Kingda Cubs."
"We have never wagered a bet like this before," Six Flags Great Adventure spokeswoman Kristin Siebeneicher said in an email. "It's a friendly competition among Six Flags sister parks, but we really hate to lose. We're rooting for the Mets all the way!"
